title: Hearty Crockpot Beef Stew for Cozy Nights
promptIMG: Food photography: Crockpot Beef Stew, appetizing presentation, natural lighting, kitchen setting, documentary style, realistic colors --ar 4:3 --quality 2
description: This hearty crockpot beef stew is the ultimate comfort meal. Tender beef, soft veggies, and a savory broth simmer together for hours. Perfect for chilly evenings or meal prep!
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Transfer the browned beef to the crockpot. Add carrots, potatoes, onion, and garlic on top.
In a bowl, mix the beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Pour this mixture over the ingredients in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours, until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
Before serving, remove the bay leaf and adjust seasoning if needed. Enjoy your cozy stew!
tips: When browning the beef, don't overcrowd the pan; this helps achieve that nice caramelization. A common mistake is skipping the browning step; it adds so much flavor! Leftovers can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days, and it reheats beautifully on the stove or in the microwave. You can also swap out potatoes for sweet potatoes for a different twist!

structured_content.content: Quick note: There's something about a warm bowl of beef stew that just screams comfort, doesn't it? This Hearty Crockpot Beef Stew is my go-to for those chilly evenings when I want a no-fuss, satisfying meal. The best part? You can just set it and forget it while the flavors meld together beautifully over hours of slow cooking.

This stew is all about the basics: tender beef, hearty vegetables, and a rich broth. I love using chuck roast because it becomes melt-in-your-mouth tender after a long cook. If you're out of beef broth, chicken broth works just fine too!
